git_base_url: The project has to be hosted in a git repository. Please provide the corresponding URL, e.g: https://github.com/deephdc :
project_name:
A short name of your project. It will be added after git repository URL (see above)
. The python package will also be named like that:
author_name: Author name(s) (and/or your organization/company/team). If many, please, separate by comma:
author_email: E-Mail(s) of main author(s). If many, separate by comma:
description: A short description of the project:
open_source_license: Select one of the licenses, default is MIT. For more info: https://opensource.org/licenses:
dockerhub_user: Your user account at hub.docker.com, e.g. "deephdc" in https://hub.docker.com/u/deephdc:
docker_baseimage: Docker image your Dockerfile starts from (FROM <docker_baseimage>)(e.g. tensorflow/tensorflow). Don't provide the tag, yet:
baseimage_cpu_tag: CPU tag for the baseimage, e.g. 2.9.1 (NB: the image must support python3):
baseimage_gpu_tag: GPU tag for the baseimage, e.g. 2.9.1-gpu (NB: same as above, the image must support python3):
failure_notify: Receive an email if module build fails
